enumMember.name: MAIN
enumMember.description: The e-fuse is configured for main load.

enumMember.name: PRIO
enumMember.description: The e-fuse is configured for prio load.

enum.name: AvailStatus
enum.description: The availability status is used to qualify the operational state. It indicates why the operational state has changed its value.

enumMember.name: IN_TEST
enumMember.description: The resource is undergoing a test procedure. If the administrative state is locked or shutting down, normal users are prevented from using the resource.

enumMember.name: FAILED
enumMember.description: The resource has an internal fault that prevents it from operating.

enumMember.name: POWER_OFF
enumMember.description: The resource requires power to be applied and is not powered on.

enumMember.name: OFF_LINE
enumMember.description: The resource requires a routine operation to be performed. This routine operation is to place the resource online and make it available for use. The operation may be manual or automatic, or both. The operational state is disabled.

enumMember.name: OFF_DUTY
enumMember.description: The resource has been made inactive by an internal control process.

enumMember.name: DEPENDENCY
enumMember.description: The resource cannot operate because some other resource on which it depends is unavailable.

enumMember.name: DEGRADED
enumMember.description: The service available from the resource is degraded in some respect.

enumMember.name: NOT_INSTALLED
enumMember.description: The resource represented by the managed object is not present, or is incomplete.

enumMember.name: LOG_FULL
enumMember.description: Indicates a log full condition. The semantics are defined in CCITT Rec. X.735 | ISO/IEC 10164-6.

enumMember.name: DEPENDENCY_LOCKED
enumMember.description: The administrative state of a resource that this resource depends on is locked. or the availability status of the other resource is dependency locked.

enumMember.name: DEPENDENCY_FAILED
enumMember.description: The availability status of a resource that this resource depends on is failed or dependency failed.

enumMember.name: DEPENDENCY_SHUTTINGDOWN
enumMember.description: The administrative state of a resource that this resource depends on is shutting down. or the availability status of the other resource is dependency shutting down.

enum.name: ApcFuseHoldUp
enum.description: Type of output. An internal consumer is a unit located inside the cabinet. An external consumer is a unit located outside of the cabinet.

enumMember.name: HOLDUP_STANDARD
enumMember.description: Output used for internal consumer requiring hold-up functionality.

enumMember.name: STANDARD
enumMember.description: Output used to feed internal consumer.

enumMember.name: HOLDUP_REMOTE
enumMember.description: Output used for internal or external consumer requiring hold-up functionality.

enumMember.name: REMOTE
enumMember.description: Output used to feed internal or external consumer.

enumMember.name: NOT_SUPPORTED
enumMember.description: Information about type of output is not available on HW.

enumMember.name: ON
enumMember.description: Set e-fuse power output to ON

enumMember.name: OFF
enumMember.description: Set e-fuse power output to OFF

enumMember.name: TEMPORARY_OFF
enumMember.description: Set e-fuse power output to TEMPORARY_OFF

enum.name: ApcIndicatorStatus
enum.description: Possible states for green, yellow and red indicators. Since the semantics of the different indicator states depend on the color of the indicator, the semantics is described as part of the corresponding indicator status attribute description.

enumMember.name: NOT_APPLICABLE
enumMember.description: The indicator is not supported.

enumMember.name: NOT_AVAILABLE
enumMember.description: The indicator state is currently not available.

enumMember.name: OFF
enumMember.description: The indicator is off.

enumMember.name: STEADY_ON
enumMember.description: The indicator is on continuously.

enumMember.name: SLOW_BLINK
enumMember.description: The indicator blinks slowly.

enumMember.name: FAST_BLINK
enumMember.description: The indicator blinks quickly.

enumMember.name: DOUBLE_FLASH_AND_STEADY_ON
enumMember.description: The indicator blinks twice and is then on for a short time. This cycle is then repeated.

enumMember.name: DOUBLE_FLASH_AND_OFF
enumMember.description: The indicator blinks twice and is then off for a short time. This cycle is then repeated.

enumMember.name: ON
enumMember.description: Power output state is ON.

enumMember.name: OFF
enumMember.description: Power output state is OFF.

enumMember.name: TEMPORARY_OFF
enumMember.description: Power output state is OFF and fuse is set in TEMPORARY_OFF state.

enumMember.name: TRIPPED
enumMember.description: Power output state is OFF and fuse is set in TRIPPED state.

enumMember.name: NOT_PRESENT
enumMember.description: Fuse is not present.

enumMember.name: NOT_SUPPORTED
enumMember.description: Power output state information is not supported by HW.

enumMember.name: DISABLED
enumMember.description: The resource is totally inoperable.

enumMember.name: ENABLED
enumMember.description: The resource is partially or fully operable.

enumMember.name: CB
enumMember.description: Fuse of Circuit Breaker (CB) type.

enumMember.name: ECM
enumMember.description: Fuse of Electronic Circuit Breaker Module (ECM) type.

enumMember.name: EFUSE
enumMember.description: Fuse of e-fuse type.

enumMember.name: NOT_SUPPORTED
enumMember.description: The fuse type information is not supported by HW.

class.name: EFuse
class.description:
This MO models an electrical fuse related to power distribution. Number of MO's is created depending on the number of EFuses on the PDU.
The RDNs of these MOs are EFuse=1, EFuse=2, and so on.
Dependencies: Can only exist when FieldReplaceableUnit MO represents a PDU.

action.name: setLoadType
action.description: Specifies if the e-fuse must be used for main or prio load. Transaction required: No.

parameter.name: loadType
parameter.description: Specifies if the e-fuse shall be used for main or prio load.

action.dependencies: Attribute remoteControllable must be set to true in order to change load type setting via this action.

action.name: setColdStartup
action.description: Specifies whether or not the e-fuse must be on at cold startup. Transaction required: No.

parameter.name: onAtColdStartup
parameter.description: Specifies if the e-fuse shall be on at cold startup or not.

action.dependencies: Attribute remoteControllable must be set to true in order to change cold startup setting via this action.

action.name: setRemoteControllable
action.description: Specifies whether or not the e-fuse can be remote controlled. Transaction required: No.

parameter.name: remoteControllable
parameter.description: Specifies if it shall be possible to control the e-fuse remotely or not.

action.name: setOutput
action.description: Activates or deactivates power output. Transaction required: No.

parameter.name: powerOutputState
parameter.description: Sets power output to ON or OFF.

action.dependencies: Attribute remoteControllable must be set to true in order to set power output via this action.
action.disturbances: Can disturb traffic if set to OFF or TEMPORARY_OFF.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description: The availability status. It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: onAtColdStartup
attribute.description:
Indicates if the e-fuse is turned on at cold-startup or not.
true: The e-fuse is turned on at cold-startup. false: The e-fuse is not turned on at cold-startup.

attribute.name: remoteControllable
attribute.description:
Indicates if the e-fuse is possible to control remotely.
true: The e-fuse is possible to control remotely. false: The e-fuse is not possible to control remotely.

attribute.name: loadType
attribute.description: Indicates if the e-fuse is used for main or prio load.

attribute.name: plugInModuleRef
attribute.description: Refers to the PlugInModule MO that represent the physical electronic circuitbreaker module this e-fuse is part of.

attribute.name: eFuseIndicator
attribute.description:
The operational status of the e-fuse. The indicator is physically located on the corresponding Power Distribution Unit (PDU).
Possible values: • NOT_APPLICABLE = This indicator is not supported. • NOT_AVAILABLE = The indicator state is currently not available. • OFF = The power is not distributed. • STEADY_ON = Power is distributed from the e-fuse port. • SLOW_BLINK = E-fuse tripped.

attribute.name: eFuseId
attribute.description:
The value component of the RDN.
The ID of the electrical fuse that matches the number on the physical e-fuse.

attribute.name: fuseRating
attribute.description: Maximum fuse rating. Given in Ampere. NOT_SUPPORTED is used for units that cannot support this attribute.

attribute.name: fuseHoldUp
attribute.description: Type of output. NOT_SUPPORTED is used for units that cannot support this attribute.

attribute.name: limitedOutputCurrentSetting
attribute.description: Fuse limitation setting. Given in Ampere. Depends on cable type connected to output. NOT_SUPPORTED is used for units that cannot support this attribute.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use. Customer-defined label that describes equipment powered by this output.

attribute.name: fuseType
attribute.description: Fuse type. NOT_SUPPORTED is used for units that cannot support this attribute.

attribute.name: fuseState
attribute.description: Fuse state. NOT_SUPPORTED is used for units that cannot support this attribute.
